     <hr style="page-break-after:always;" /><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:bold;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">EVO TRANSPORTATION &amp; ENERGY SERVICES, INC.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:bold;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">Notes to Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:left;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p></ix:exclude><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:10.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">forth </span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">in the agreement. Because the exercise notice did not specify a number of shares subject to the  notice as required by the acquisition agreement, the Company has asserted it does not have the obligation to do so under the terms of the acquisition agreement.  The redemption period set forth in the acquisition agreement has since lapsed.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:10.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">On January 2, 2019, Sheehy Enterprises, Inc. (&#x201c;SEI&#x201d;), a related party, and Sheehy entered into an equipment lease agreement (the &#x201c;Equipment Lease&#x201d;), whereby SEI agreed to lease to Sheehy certain truck and trailer equipment owned by SEI. The Company agreed to pay SEI an amount equal to $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_623f4c86-2473-49bc-a3d6-ada234c5cdc5" contextRef="C_7e8dda63-7923-4a2f-8654-8d0cd66b215f" name="evoa:LeaseAgreementInitialPaymentPerEachMonth" unitRef="U_USD" decimals="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">92,000</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> per month for approximately </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_fc893b19-105d-4f72-9b03-5c15555432d6" contextRef="C_7e8dda63-7923-4a2f-8654-8d0cd66b215f" name="evoa:LeaseAgreementPaymentPeriod" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">44 months</span></ix:nonNumeric></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">, in addition to a promissory note (the &#x201c;Sheehy Note&#x201d;) in the principal amount of $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_78b317d7-0212-4127-8757-8abe579e15c3" contextRef="C_4c485962-0316-4497-a527-6123bcd1d219" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFaceAmount" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="-5" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.4</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million to SEI. The Sheehy Note bears interest at the rate of </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_c781cacf-5846-4a33-8120-afcc4ac7fe9f" contextRef="C_41987719-0c50-4ae7-93f3-db26adcadeba" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateDuringPeriod" unitRef="U_pure" scale="-2" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">5.65</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">% per annum and had an initial </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_d05eb2a0-16d5-43e5-98a9-dc9db47adc7f" contextRef="C_a7b0d1a1-2745-48ad-8540-93001650841e" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentMaturityDateDescription"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">maturity date of March 3, 2019</span></ix:nonNumeric></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">. The Sheehy Note provides for up to four automatic extensions of the maturity date of 30 days each, provided that the Sheehy Note is not in default as of the date of each extension. If the principal and accrued interest on the Sheehy Note are not repaid by the end of the final maturity date extension term, then the principal and accrued interest amount of the Sheehy Note increases to $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_a8d445aa-a376-4dba-9936-5466149a2683" contextRef="C_a5dcf21c-a801-40be-be04-67d3960e9f53" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentPeriodicPaymentTermsBalloonPaymentToBePaid" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="-4" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.45</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million and the balance of the Sheehy Note automatically converts into shares of the Company&#x2019;s common stock at a rate of $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_0e423678-b322-4dcc-8ca0-7cef18675f13" contextRef="C_a5dcf21c-a801-40be-be04-67d3960e9f53" name="us-gaap:CommonStockParOrStatedValuePerShare" unitRef="U_UnitedStatesOfAmericaDollarsShare" decimals="INF">2.50</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> per share. As of the final maturity extension date, the principal amount of $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_dee818b4-5295-46fe-89a0-60355c03fdd5" contextRef="C_eb56fbfa-38bf-4fce-8778-c68868ed92db" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFaceAmount" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="-5" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.4</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million was outstanding. In accordance with the terms of the Sheehy Note, the principal amount increased to $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_174c044b-a783-4582-9ea5-c0fc79bd35a4" contextRef="C_81359524-a708-48b6-b3ab-f35d671e8b95" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentPeriodicPaymentTermsBalloonPaymentToBePaid" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="-4" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.45</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million. There also were intercompany receivables and payables due by and between EVO and certain entities owned by SEI shareholders (see </span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:italic;">Note 5 &#x2013; Related Party Transactions &#x2013; Due from Related Party</span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">). On November 18, 2019, the Company entered into an Intercompany Debt Repayment and Settlement Agreement (the &#x201c;Intercompany Agreement&#x201d;) by and between the Company, the stockholder, SEI and North American Dispatch Systems (&#x201c;NADS&#x201d;). Pursuant to this agreement, EVO assigned $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_e94f900f-d539-4326-91ef-5ffae8fb5ae2" contextRef="C_212e0edc-3e28-4e23-ad10-5d3fd17cd758" name="us-gaap:NotesPayableRelatedPartiesClassifiedCurrent" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="-5" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.4</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million of their outstanding receivable balance due from NADS as partial payment of the Sheehy Note. The remaining principal amount due, plus accrued interest on the Sheehy Note of $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_4af7f73b-23a4-455e-b175-c0956e9b5279" contextRef="C_ebc0a2ee-da26-472a-b6fe-5439eb30aa5b" name="evoa:DebtConversionInterestDebtAmount" unitRef="U_USD" decimals="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">40,000</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> was paid in the form of </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_d52636d3-8c41-45b9-85cb-0c0347ac7777" contextRef="C_c124b338-aa3d-49b4-8977-0058a9701fd2" name="us-gaap:DebtConversionConvertedInstrumentSharesIssued1" unitRef="U_shares" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">35,156</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> shares of EVO common stock. No gain on settlement of related party debt was recorded. No further amounts are owed on the Sheehy Note.</span></p><ix:exclude><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:12.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">14</span></p>

The goodwill, which is deductible for income tax purposes, was assigned to the Company&#x2019;s Trucking reporting unit.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:10.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:italic;">Ursa and JB Lease</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:6.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">On February 1, 2019, the Company purchased all of the outstanding interests in Ursa for </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_a581532c-153c-4d9f-b767-03fb2a3ae1f1" contextRef="C_ae9c624d-455b-4d6c-a099-ad6319ab5382" name="us-gaap:BusinessAcquisitionEquityInterestsIssuedOrIssuableNumberOfSharesIssued" unitRef="U_shares" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">800,000</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> shares of the Company&#x2019;s common stock. In connection with the Ursa acquisition the Company acquired JB Lease, an affiliate of Ursa. The goodwill, which is not deductible for income tax purposes, was assigned to the Company&#x2019;s Trucking reporting unit.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:10.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span   <div style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_38314d7c-bba1-435f-93c4-e2519e11b575" contextRef="C_1c72b33e-923d-4c52-8f52-e6166ffc3740" name="us-gaap:SegmentReportingDisclosureTextBlock" escape="true"><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:18.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">Note 4 - Segment Reporting</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:6.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">The Company uses the &#34;management approach&#34; to determine its operating and reportable segments. The management approach focuses on the financial information that the Company's chief operating decision maker uses to evaluate performance and allocate resources to the Company's operations. </span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">The Company&#x2019;s </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_8cd86c5d-1cdd-41bd-9ccb-a584edef9d23" contextRef="C_38c34624-1b03-444a-8f55-c077890c77ea" name="us-gaap:NumberOfReportableSegments" unitRef="U_Segment" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen"><ix:nonFraction id="F_e300d5c9-96f7-4cbd-b9ca-fd98b80006ed" contextRef="C_38c34624-1b03-444a-8f55-c077890c77ea" name="us-gaap:NumberOfOperatingSegments" unitRef="U_Segment" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">two</ix:nonFraction></ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> operating and reportable segments are Trucking and CNG Fueling Stations. Corporate and Unallocated represents expenses that are not allocated to a reportable segment including corporate general and administrative expenses and other corporate costs such as change in fair value of warrant liabilities, change in fair value of embedded derivative liability, loss on extinguishment of debt, and interest expense on certain debt obligations.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> </span>&#160;</p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:italic;">Trucking</span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">. The Company&#x2019;s Trucking segment provides surface transportation services to the USPS and other customers.</span></p><ix:exclude><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:12.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">19</span></p>
     <hr style="page-break-after:always;" /><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:bold;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">EVO TRANSPORTATION &amp; ENERGY SERVICES, INC.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New to Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:left;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p></ix:exclude><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:italic;"> </span>&#160;</p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span Stations</span><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">. </span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">We own </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_570b44f7-1bd8-43fd-90c2-dee8d094624e" contextRef="C_38c34624-1b03-444a-8f55-c077890c77ea" name="evoa:NumberOfOperatingFuelingStations" unitRef="U_Station" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">three</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> CNG fueling stations that serve our fleet and other customers. Those stations are located in Fort Worth, TX, Oak Creek, WI, and Tolleson, AZ and accommodate class 8 trucks and trailers. We have </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_92921e1b-2dbf-4795-87ab-591e10bac111" contextRef="C_38c34624-1b03-444a-8f55-c077890c77ea" name="evoa:AdditionalNumberOfOperatingFuelingStations" unitRef="U_Station" decimals="INF" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">two</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> additional CNG fueling stations located in Jurupa Valley, CA and San Antonio, TX that are no longer operational.</span></p><div style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_65aeee20-8449-4757-ab04-05f657349ec5" contextRef="C_1c72b33e-923d-4c52-8f52-e6166ffc3740" name="us-gaap:ReconciliationOfOperatingProfitLossFromSegmentsToConsolidatedTextBlock" escape="true"><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:10.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">The following tables present the Company&#x2019;s financial information by segment. </span><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(33,37,41,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">Management does not use assets by segment to evaluate performance or allocate resources. SEI and NADS are companies controlled by the former owner of Sheehy, who was an officer of the Company until October 9, 2020. The transactions representing the balance due to SEI and due from NADS at January 2, 2019 were for ordinary course business transactions incurred prior to the acquisition. The balance due to the officer on the acquisition date represents personal funds advanced to Sheehy for general working capital purposes prior to the acquisition. On January 7, 2019, the Company transferred a total of $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_bc9f7142-057e-4493-971a-f7d15ee9e8a0" contextRef="C_817d3f1e-d758-4d5f-9601-5dfa12809d96" name="us-gaap:RepaymentsOfRelatedPartyDebt" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="-4" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.15</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million to SEI to fully repay the balance due to the officer and reduce the payable due to SEI.</span></p><div style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_c0a671b0-a13d-4b83-997e-d9ca66756e35" contextRef="C_1c72b33e-923d-4c52-8f52-e6166ffc3740" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfRelatedPartyTransactionsTableTextBlock" escape="true"><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p>

Collateral Security Pledge Agreement</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:6.0pt;line-height:1.035;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">On January 31, 2019, the Company entered into a letter agreement with SEI to satisfy the Sheehy captive insurance security deposit requirement for 2019 (see Note 12,</span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-style:italic;">Commitments and Contingencies &#x2013; Off Balance Sheet Arrangements &#x2013; Captive Insurance</span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">). The letter agreement references a Collateral Security Pledge Agreement among SEI, Sheehy and the insurance captive (&#x201c;CSPA&#x201d;). Under the CSPA, SEI has pledged a total of $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_c5b58430-2828-43f0-861b-1c39e6637797" contextRef="C_9b6632eb-e1ed-4ace-ae90-ddf3cf3543f0" name="us-gaap:SecurityDeposit" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="-5" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.3</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million in cash and investments held in the SEI captive insurance member account. The pledged collateral remains the exclusive property of SEI and any interest earned on the pledged collateral during the term of the agreement will accrue exclusively to the benefit of SEI. The Company has no claim to the pledged collateral or any accrued interest. The letter agreement expired on </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_abc27ce2-9f69-4ac0-a73c-dc7843bacdd0" contextRef="C_30a6371e-201f-4557-b983-9850d8e4cc9a" name="us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionDate" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">March 1, 2020</span></ix:nonNumeric></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">, however, the CPSA requires the consent of the Company in order for it to be terminated and the Company has not to date granted its consent.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:10.0pt;line-height:1.0589583333333332;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:underline;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">Purchase of Fixed Assets</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:6.0pt;line-height:1.0589583333333332;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">On October 15, 2019, the </span><span   <div><ix:nonNumeric id="F_144a3a9f-76b9-4562-9449-7391ce304274" contextRef="C_1c72b33e-923d-4c52-8f52-e6166ffc3740" name="evoa:FactoredAccountsReceivableTextBlock" escape="true"><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:18.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">Note 6 &#x2013; Factoring Arrangements</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:6.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="F_c5ebabf6-34b2-4ef4-a084-6d7b7ca9421d" contextRef="C_1c72b33e-923d-4c52-8f52-e6166ffc3740" name="evoa:DescriptionOfFactoredAccountsReceivable" continuedAt="F_c5ebabf6-34b2-4ef4-a084-6d7b7ca9421d_1"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">Certain </span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">of the Company&#x2019;s wholly-owned subsidiaries have entered into accounts receivable factoring arrangements with a financial institution (the &#x201c;Factor&#x201d;) with termination dates starting in September 2021 that automatically renew for successive one-year periods </span></ix:nonNumeric></span><span style=""></span></p><ix:exclude><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:12.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">21</span></p>
     <hr style="page-break-after:always;" /><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:bold;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">EVO TRANSPORTATION &amp; ENERGY SERVICES, INC.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:bold;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">Notes to Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:left;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p></ix:exclude><div style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:continuation id="F_c5ebabf6-34b2-4ef4-a084-6d7b7ca9421d_1"><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">(absent </span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">either party's written election to terminate, which did not occur). Pursuant to the terms of the agreements, the Company, from time to time, sells to the Factor certain of its accounts receivable balances on a recourse basis for credit-approved accounts. The Factor remits </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_863215e4-cbc4-4ff5-819d-4f8af832980e" contextRef="C_1c72b33e-923d-4c52-8f52-e6166ffc3740" name="evoa:FactorRemitsPercentageOfContractedAccountsReceivable" unitRef="U_pure" scale="-2" decimals="2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">95</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">% of the contracted accounts receivable balance for a given month to the Company (the &#x201c;Advance Amount&#x201d;) with the remaining balance, less fees, to be forwarded once the Factor collects the full accounts receivable balance from the customer.</span></p></ix:continuation></div><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> </span>&#160;</p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">For long-term contracts with credit worthy customers, the Factor may advance, at their discretion, unearned future contract amounts. Unearned advances are secured by all factored and non-factored long-term contract cash receipts, which are remitted directly to the Factor by the customer. </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_145c3f24-a105-41c0-8578-dbeecd87e65c" contextRef="C_1c72b33e-923d-4c52-8f52-e6166ffc3740" name="evoa:ScheduleOfEarnedAndUnearnedComponentsIncludedInAdvancesFromFactoringArrangementTableTextBlock" escape="true" continuedAt="F_145c3f24-a105-41c0-8578-dbeecd87e65c_1"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">Earned and unearned components included in Advances from factoring arrangement are as follows:</span></ix:nonNumeric></span></p><div style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:continuation id="F_145c3f24-a105-41c0-8578-dbeecd87e65c_1"><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p>

Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">Concurrently with the Ritter acquisition on September 16, 2019, </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_778187ac-cc34-4985-92ff-eeed5fb05baf" contextRef="C_950e8d04-d2e8-4ba5-82c4-8645e2417fa6" name="evoa:AgreementDescription"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">the Company entered into a $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_4d310e59-19b9-4fe5-b0e9-ddb6b3c3692b" contextRef="C_86fc46ac-abf3-4c6b-927c-e1a69ad68746" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFaceAmount" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">24.5</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million financing agreement (the &#x201c;Financing Agreement&#x201d;) among the Company, each subsidiary of the Company, various lenders from time to time party thereto, and Cortland Capital Market Services LLC, as administrative agent and collateral agent. Pursuant to the Financing Agreement, the Company initially borrowed $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_40bc3b4b-83a3-4b67-8407-d62b6942d41e" contextRef="C_86fc46ac-abf3-4c6b-927c-e1a69ad68746" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentCarryingAmount" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="-5" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">22.4</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million and borrowed the remaining $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_f55bee97-67c1-4067-95b3-41356510d4ca" contextRef="C_9f54e2f4-d1a8-433e-b7be-fb00bde7058b" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentCarryingAmount" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="-5" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2.1</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million during October 2019 (the &#x201c;Term Loan&#x201d;).</span></ix:nonNumeric></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> All of the Company&#x2019;s subsidiaries were originally guarantors under the Financing Agreement. The Term Loan is secured by all assets of the Company and its subsidiaries, including pledges of all equity in the Company&#x2019;s subsidiaries and is not subject to registration rights. The Financing Agreement contains covenants, subject to specific exceptions, that limit (i) the making of investments, (ii) the incurrence of additional indebtedness, (iii) the incurrence of liens, (iv) payments and asset transfers with restricted junior loan parties or subsidiaries, including dividends, (v) transactions with shareholders and affiliates, (vi) asset dispositions and acquisitions, among others. The Term Loan bears interest at </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_031d1a91-153e-4bfc-895e-b995c15d6e24" contextRef="C_86fc46ac-abf3-4c6b-927c-e1a69ad68746" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" unitRef="U_pure" scale="-2" decimals="2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">12</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">% per annum and had an original maturity date of </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_2efda73f-5531-400a-9f5f-e3becf830342" contextRef="C_8bc6515b-aa33-47d6-b5d6-ac17a3bbaad3" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentMaturityDate" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">September 16, 2022</span></ix:nonNumeric></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">. Until December 31, 2019, interest on the Term Loan was paid in kind and capitalized as additional principal, and the Company had the option to pay interest on the capitalized interest in cash or in kind. All interest payments on the Term Loan during 2019 were in kind. After December 31, 2019, monthly interest payments were due in cash, and all outstanding principal and interest will be due on the maturity date. </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_397442ba-afff-4540-bb42-27260cb397f9" contextRef="C_950e8d04-d2e8-4ba5-82c4-8645e2417fa6" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentDescription"><span payment of a prepayment premium of (1) </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New      <hr style="page-break-after:always;" /><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:bold;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">EVO TRANSPORTATION &amp; ENERGY SERVICES, INC.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:bold;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">Notes to Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:left;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p></ix:exclude><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">exercise </span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">period (the Warrant Shares are &#x201c;in the money&#x201d;), then any outstanding Antara Warrants that are in the money will be automatically deemed to be exercised immediately prior to the end of the exercise period. Pursuant to the Antara Warrants, the Company granted Antara Capital preemptive rights to purchase its pro rata share, determined based on the number of shares held by Antara Capital or into which Antara Capital&#x2019;s Antara Warrants are exercisable, of capital stock issued by the Company after the issuance date of the Antara Warrants, subject to certain excepted issuances.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">The Company issued a warrant for </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1,500,000</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> shares of common stock to Antara at an exercise price of $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_7a51da72-e525-4378-9429-1dfdc9f1d0a5" contextRef="C_a4b65254-32cb-49ca-9cd2-80a0cc9de715" name="us-gaap:ClassOfWarrantOrRightExercisePriceOfWarrantsOrRights1" unitRef="U_UnitedStatesOfAmericaDollarsShare" decimals="INF">0.01</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> per share (the &#x201c;Side Letter Warrant&#x201d;) subject to an acquisition agreement between the Company and LoadTrek. LoadTrek is a GPS system designed for the trucking industry, owned by a related party. If the Company were to successfully complete an acquisition of certain assets of LoadTrek or meet financial performance metrics set forth in the warrant agreement, all or a portion of the shares underlying the Side Letter Warrant were subject to cancellation. The Company did not acquire the LoadTrek assets and the Side Letter Warrant was subsequently amended to remove the cancellation provision and, therefore, none of the shares underlying the warrant were cancelled.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> </span>&#160;</p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">Since the Term Loan, Antara Warrants, and Side Letter Warrant were negotiated in contemplation of each other and executed within a short period of time, the Company evaluated the debt and warrants as a combined arrangement. Since the Antara Warrants and Side Letter Warrants are liability classified we recorded these items at their fair value and the residual proceeds were allocated to the Term Loan. The non-lender fees incurred to establish the financing arrangement were allocated to the Term Loan and capitalized on the Company&#x2019;s balance sheet as debt issuance costs, which are amortized using the effective interest method into interest expense over the term of the Term Loan.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:left;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:left;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">The Term Loan was further evaluated for the existence of embedded features to be bifurcated from the amount allocated to the debt component. The Term Loan agreement contains a mandatory prepayment feature that was determined to be an embedded derivative, requiring bifurcation and fair value recognition for the derivative liability. The fair value of this derivative liability is remeasured at each reporting period, with changes in fair value recognized in the consolidated statement of operations. Any changes in the assumptions used in measuring the fair value of the derivative liability could result in a material increase or decrease in its carrying value. The allocation of the proceeds to the debt component and the bifurcation of the embedded derivative liability resulted in a $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_472cefa6-6df4-4f0d-ad55-a0eccbf35944" contextRef="C_32c5e3d4-6ea6-4708-a807-be53fa35faba" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentUnamortizedDiscount" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="-5" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">9.0</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million debt discount that will be amortized to interest expense over the term of the Term Loan.</span></p><p The issuance of this warrant results in an additional debt discount that will be amortized to interest expense over the term of the debt using the effective interest method. The Antara Warrant 2020 is exercisable for </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_fa1d8f48-503b-4f6d-800b-4d7ef00e2a24" contextRef="C_92166abf-5b7a-4d57-8ef1-7dd73b9cc1a3" name="us-gaap:WarrantsAndRightsOutstandingTerm" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">ten years</span></ix:nonNumeric></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> from the date of issuance. If the fair market value of the Antara Warrant Shares 2020 is greater than $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_b72145e4-c3e7-4aa9-ae16-0861c4e35118" contextRef="C_5e31c805-324c-46b9-aaf1-b35fad0033a0" name="us-gaap:ClassOfWarrantOrRightExercisePriceOfWarrantsOrRights1" unitRef="U_UnitedStatesOfAmericaDollarsShare" decimals="INF">2.50</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> at the end of the exercise period, then the Antara Warrant 2020 will be deemed to be exercised automatically and immediately prior to the end of the exercise period. Pursuant to the Antara Warrant 2020, the Company granted Antara Capital preemptive rights to purchase its pro rata share, determined based on the number of shares held by Antara Capital or into which warrants held by Antara Capital (including the Antara Warrant 2020) are exercisable, of capital stock issued by the Company after the issuance date of the Antara Warrant 2020, subject to certain excepted issuances.</span></ix:nonNumeric></span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> </span>&#160;</p><ix:exclude><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:12.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">23</span></p>
     <hr style="page-break-after:always;" /><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:bold;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">EVO TRANSPORTATION &amp; ENERGY SERVICES, INC.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:bold;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">Notes to Unaudited Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:left;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p></ix:exclude><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">The Company accounted for the Incremental Amendment as a modification of the Financing Agreement. The Company capitalized the estimated fair value of the Antara Warrant 2020 and fees paid to Antara on its balance sheet as a discount on the Incremental Term Loans, which is amortized using the effective interest method into interest expense over the term of the Incremental Term Loans.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times Roman;font-style:italic;">Paycheck Protection Program Loan</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.231458333333333;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:6.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> </span>&#160;</p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">On April 15, 2020, the Company obtained a loan (the &#x201c;Loan&#x201d;) from BOKF, N.A. (dba Bank of Oklahoma) in the amount of $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_f531786b-b7f6-41e6-9460-229b389da3a5" contextRef="C_1ffb230c-4edd-4221-b260-4cf0cb072bf6" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFaceAmount" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">10.0</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million under the Paycheck Protection Program (the &#x201c;PPP&#x201d;) of the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (&#x201c;CARES&#x201d;) Act. The Loan, which is memorialized by a Note dated April 15, 2020 issued by the Company, was scheduled to mature on </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_f30adaa0-73a2-4514-b20d-30c7d1917794" contextRef="C_e449187a-2cc3-494c-8daf-4d109bfcb500" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentMaturityDate" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen"><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">April 15, 2022</span></ix:nonNumeric></span><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> and bore interest at a rate of </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_8562eff5-c5e0-4f21-8d93-d058330b8fd1" contextRef="C_1ffb230c-4edd-4221-b260-4cf0cb072bf6" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" unitRef="U_pure" scale="-2" decimals="INF" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1.00</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">% per annum, payable </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonNumeric id="F_59a0c587-ef44-4111-b7cc-e22f5fe9d027" contextRef="C_e449187a-2cc3-494c-8daf-4d109bfcb500" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFrequencyOfPeriodicPayment"><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">monthly</span></ix:nonNumeric></span><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> commencing on November 15, 2020. The Company was able to prepay the Note at any time prior to maturity with </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_22b32a09-b6a8-4cbe-b698-2686f6417045" contextRef="C_e449187a-2cc3-494c-8daf-4d109bfcb500" name="evoa:DebtInstrumentPrepaymentPenalty" unitRef="U_USD" scale="3" decimals="-3" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">no</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> prepayment penalties. The principal amount of the Loan and accrued interest were eligible for forgiveness after </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><span style="-sec-ix-hidden:F_26abdc03-3f69-435d-82b9-b1041384ac27;"><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">eight week</span></span></span><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">s if the Company used the Loan proceeds for qualifying expenses, including payroll, rent, and utilities and the Company maintained its payroll levels. The Company used the entire Loan amount for qualifying expenses, and the entire amount borrowed under the Loan was forgiven by the SBA in July 2021.</span></p><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:justify;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p><ix:exclude><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:12.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">24</span></p>
     <hr style="page-break-after:always;" /><p style="text-indent:0.0%;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.15;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:center;"><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:bold;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">EVO TRANSPORTATION &amp; style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">% per annum.  The principal amount of the Loan and accrued interest were eligible for forgiveness after </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><span style="-sec-ix-hidden:F_84e4481a-5e3c-4f0c-9e4d-0853db170e18;"><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">eight weeks</span></span></span><span style="background-color:rgba(255,255,255,1);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> if the Company used the Loan proceeds for qualifying expenses, including payroll, rent, and utilities and the Company maintained its payroll levels. The Company used the entire Loan amount for qualifying expenses, and the entire amount borrowed under the Loan, including accrued interest, was forgiven by the SBA in July 2021.</span></p><div style="display:flex;margin-top:10.0pt;line-height:1.15;justify-content:flex-start;align-items:baseline;margin-bottom:0.0pt;min-width:3.333%;text-align:justify;"><span During September 2020, the Company sold certain assets that are collateral for the notes payable to a third party for aggregate proceeds of $</span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction id="F_832225ea-17ac-4ef0-a6c5-b882fc75b5e7" contextRef="C_43c3b351-67bb-49df-b96b-49f9efa33dfb" name="us-gaap:ProceedsFromSaleOfPropertyPlantAndEquipment" unitRef="U_USD" scale="6" decimals="-5" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.7</ix:nonFraction></span><span style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"> million, used such proceeds to extinguish the notes payable, and entered into a lease agreement with the third party under which the Company agreed to lease back the assets. Because the lease back is classified as a finance lease, the Company determined that it did not relinquish control of the assets to the buyer-lessor. Therefore, the Company accounted for the transaction as a failed sale-leaseback whereby the Company continues to depreciate the assets and recorded a financing obligation for the consideration received from the buyer-lessor. </span><span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);color:rgba(0,0,0,1);white-space:pre-wrap;font-weight:normal;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;"><ix:nonFraction         <td style="background-color:rgba(0,0,0,0);word-break:break-word;vertical-align:bottom;"><p style="text-indent:0.0pt;font-size:10.0pt;margin-top:0.0pt;line-height:1.05;font-family:Times New Roman;margin-bottom:0.0pt;text-align:left;"><span style="white-space:pre-wrap;font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;">&#160;</span></p></td>
